conclusion: Analyze liquid flow from containers A, B, C, and D to containers E or F through baffles.
First image shows initial setup with colored markers labeling positions.
Second image shows liquid flowing from top containers.
Liquid starts at green container A.
Liquid flows downward and encounters green baffle.
Green baffle directs flow toward left side.
Liquid continues toward left bottom area leading to container E.
Liquid starts at yellow container B.
Liquid flows downward and encounters teal baffle.
Teal baffle directs flow toward right.
Yellow liquid flows along teal baffle in second image.
Liquid flows toward right side leading to container F.
Liquid starts at blue container C.
Liquid flows downward in nearly straight line.
Blue liquid flows down and appears to mix with yellow liquid in second image.
Blue liquid follows path to right side leading to container F.
Liquid starts at white container D.
Liquid flows straight downward.
White liquid flows in straight line in second image.
No baffles redirect white liquid; it reaches right side leading to container F.
Liquid from A flows into E; liquid from B, C, and D flows into F.
